intro: Calligonum repetekense, commonly known as the desert buckthorn, is a shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its dense, sprawling growth habit and small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters, which are followed by dark blue berries that are edible for both humans and wildlife. It is well adapted to harsh environments, with deep roots that allow it to survive in poor soils and extreme temperatures. Calligonum repetekense plays an important ecological role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing food and shelter for desert fauna.
